thread.title: ShopRite offers N.Y.C. Wine & Food Festival discount
thread.title_full: ShopRite offers N.Y.C. Wine & Food Festival discount

author: Kimberly L. Jackson | For The Star-Ledger
title: ShopRite offers N.Y.C. Wine & Food Festival discount
text:
ShopRite offers N.Y.C. Wine & Food Festival discount ShopRite_Grand_Tasting_2012.JPG Crowds at the Grand Tasting Presented by ShopRite at the 2012 New York City Wine & Food Festival (Photo by Kimberly L. Jackson) (Kimberly L. Jackson ) Comments 
Every year, those attending the Grand Tasting presented by ShopRite at the New York City Wine & Food Festival are challenged to avoid filling up too fast as they sample the numerous foods, wines and spirits on offer in a space that's bigger than two football fields. 
On two stages for this year's event on Oct. 17 and 18, Food Network and Cooking Channel chefs and cookbook authors also will be a major draw for Samsung culinary demonstrations featuring Giada De Laurentiis , Emeril Lagasse , Rachel Ray , Andrew Zimmern , Tyler Florence , Michael Symon , Patti LaBelle , Valerie Bertinelli and others. 
And for the eighth year, ShopRite's culinary team will be at the center of it all, working behind the scenes in a temporary kitchen at Pier 94 (West Side Highway at 55th Street in Manhattan) to demonstrate the culinary potential of specialty ingredients found in its stores. ShopRite corporate chef Lynn Logg has developed a recipe that blends lobster, fresh herbs and other ingredients into ShopRite Kitchen brand prepared mac and cheese. The dish will be among festival samples, demonstrating an easy option for entertaining. Wine tasting on a grand scale at the Grand Tasting presented by ShopRite at the New York City Wine & Food Festival. (Photo by Kimberly L. Jackson) 
ShopRite Price Plus Club Card holders can get 10 percent off the $185 ticket price for Grand Tasting tickets purchased online. Those who add $40 to the admission price will have access to rare, exclusive or limited vintage wines in the Wine Gems Collection Room presented by Wine Spectator magazine . 
Those who buy New York City Wine & Food Festival tickets will be helping fight hunger beyond their own as they take their fill. Event proceeds benefit the Food Bank for New York City and Share Our Strength's No Kid Hungry campaign, with more than $8.5 million raised to date. 
The Grand Tasting offers an opportunity to sample premier wines and spirits along with popular fare from local restaurants and novelty sweets shops as well as products and recipes developed by major food and cookware brands. It is the festival's centerpiece event, taking place in addition to sell-out cooking classes, tasting sessions, foodie talks, late night parties and more running Oct. 15 through 18. See the full festival line-up at nycwff.org .
